Package com.jalios.jcmsplugin.esn.ui

Class AbstractPropertyUI<C extends IJspUIContext>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jalios.jcmsplugin.esn.ui.AbstractPropertyUI<C>
  • Type Parameters:
    C - type of context
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    IJspUI<C>, IUI<C>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractPropertyUIList, AbstractPropertyUIListItem
    public abstract class AbstractPropertyUI<C extends IJspUIContext>
extends java.lang.Object
implements IJspUI<C>
    An user interface (UI) rendered by a JSP, and an optional label.

    Instances are loaded using JProperties given a property prefix.

    Custom fields can be implemented by providing getters (eg: isEnabled() and ENABLED_PROP_SUFFIX).

    Example of UI configuration: 

     # property prefix: esn.ui.foo-ui
 esn.ui.foo-ui.jsp: plugin/ESNPlugin/jsp/foo-ui.jsp
 esn.ui.foo-ui.enabled: true | false
    Subclass to provide custom fields like: 
     # custom property
 esn.ui.foo-ui.bar: baz
    Since:
    esn-6.2
    Author:
    Sylvain Devaux

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractPropertyUI

        public AbstractPropertyUI​(java.lang.String property,
                          C context)
        Inits .jsp sub properties.

        Example: if propertyIdentifier is jcmsplugin.esn.foo-ui, it will resolve: 

         jcmsplugin.esn.foo-ui.jsp: path/to/foo.jsp
        Parameters:
        property - property prefix
        context - init context
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if property is null
        See Also:
        getJsp()

        public boolean isEnabled​(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)

        Can be skipped using request using disable(HttpServletRequest).

        Parameters:
        request - current request
        Returns:
        true (by default) to validate UI can be rendered

      • getPropertyKey

        public java.lang.String getPropertyKey​(java.lang.String suffix)
        Computes a property key based on getProperty() and given suffix, appended after a ".".

        Eg: suffix="index" and property="esn.ui.foo"-> returns "esn.ui.foo.index"

        Parameters:
        suffix - the subproperties' suffix
        Returns:
        a full property with given suffix
